name: Creative Confidence
author: Tom Kelley & David Kelley
description: An inspiring book on we can tap into our creative potential easily.

name: The Design of Everyday Things
author: Don Norman
description: A classic book on user-centric design that is still applicable in digital product design.

name: Hooked
author: Nir Eyal & Ryan Hoover
description: Interesting insights on driving user engagement.

name: Sprint
author: Jake Knapp
description: A guide on running design sprints - a problem solving methodology with design.

name: Lean UX
author: Jeff Gothelf & Josh Seiden
description: UX principles to rapidly test, evaluate and validate ideas with users.

name: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
description: How habits are formed and how they can be transformed into positive practices.

name: Accessibility for Everyone
author: Laura Kalbag
description: Designing for accesibility with helpful guidelines and best practices.

name: Quiet
author: Susan Cain
description: A book on how introverts can use their strength and become successful.
